result.execSummary:
The defendant Kirk P. Knight was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Forthwith
Consecutive to: any other sentences or commitments.

superMiscConds.notes: Undergo any counseling per agent.  No possession or use of any controlled substances without a valid Rx.   Submit to DNA sample, unless already provided.  If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kirk P. Knight in court with attorney David A Geier.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court received letters by fax in support. State reviewed as well.  PSI received and reviewed.  No corrections.  K.K., mother of defendant, makes statement to court.  A.W., significant other of defendant.  Makes statement to court.  State gives sentencing argument.  6 years Prison, 4 years I.C. and 2 years Extended Supervision with all other conditions of PSI.  Attorney Geier responds and gives recommended sentencing argument.  Request an imposed but stayed prison sentence, ordering probation with conditions.  Defendant makes final statement to court.  Court goes through sentencing requirements.  Credit by stipulation.  Court imposes sentence.

WI State Prison for 5 years (2 years 6 months Initial Confinement/ 2 years 6 months Extended Supervision) 
DNA sample, unless already provided.
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
No possession or use of any controlled substances w/out a valid Rx.
$268.00 Costs and $250.00 DNA sample & Supervision Fees
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Eligible for Earned Release
Felony admonishments.
Paperwork handed in court.
Attorney Geier request 2 days to take care of employment/housing issues.  Court denies.
Sentencing hearing at 05-13-2015 10:00 am
Sentencing hearing on May 1, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Kirk P. Knight in court with attorney David A Geier.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Geier gives status.  Defendant currently in treatment.  Plea today and set out further for sentencing.  Free to argue. No contest plea entered.  No PSI requested.  Attorney Geier agrees.  Defendant agrees to no PSI.  Court confirms and questions defendant on right to a PSI.  After further discussion, Attorney Geier requests PSI.  Matter set for sentencing.  PSI to be completed by April 23, 2015.  Bond continues.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
